title: Canadian High Schools Model United Nations (CAHSMUN)
description: CAHSMUN is one of Canada’s best-known student-run MUN conferences, with a long-running reputation for strong chairing and serious committee work. It draws delegations from across Canada and often beyond, so it feels like a real circuit event rather than a single-school conference. If you want a high-quality, classic MUN experience with strong debate culture, this is a solid flagship pick.
format: Opening Ceremony -> Committee Sessions (GA/SC/Crisis) -> Draft Resolutions/Directives -> Negotiation & Voting -> Closing Ceremony
eligibility: High school delegates (typically Grades 9-12); usually school delegations, some conferences allow independent delegates (check registration page).
howToApply: 1. Open the official site. 2. Go to registration. 3. Register as a school delegation (or individual if offered). 4. Submit delegation details and preferences. 5. Pay fees and await country/committee assignments.

title: Canadian International Model United Nations (CAIMUN)
description: CAIMUN is a major Vancouver-area MUN that attracts a broad mix of local and international-style delegations. It is well regarded for structured committees and a competitive but welcoming atmosphere, which makes it good for both first-timers and experienced delegates. It’s also a strong option if you want a conference that feels polished and professionally run.
format: Opening Ceremony -> Committee Sessions -> Moderated/Unmoderated Caucus -> Resolutions/Directives -> Voting -> Closing Ceremony
eligibility: High school delegates (typically Grades 9-12); commonly school delegations.
howToApply: 1. Visit the official site. 2. Find the conference registration section. 3. Register your delegation and submit required information. 4. Complete payment steps. 5. Watch email updates for assignments and prep materials.

title: Vancouver Model United Nations (VMUN)
description: VMUN is one of the most recognized MUN conferences in Western Canada and is often a key date on the student circuit. Its scale and committee variety give it that big-conference energy, with lots of different debate styles and difficulty levels. If you want a conference where you can find your niche, from beginner committees to advanced crisis, VMUN usually delivers.
format: Opening Ceremony -> Committee Sessions -> Caucus & Negotiation -> Draft Resolutions/Directives -> Voting -> Closing Ceremony
eligibility: High school delegates (typically Grades 9-12); usually school delegations.
howToApply: 1. Go to the official VMUN website. 2. Navigate to registration. 3. Register as a delegation and submit details. 4. Pay fees. 5. Await assignments and study guides.
